explanation: Agent A is correct. In builds where none of the conditional blocks that can modify ret are present (for example when __linux__ is defined, or when no sysctl-related macros are enabled), ret is initialized to -1 and never changed. The test if (0 >= ret) then always succeeds and causes an immediate return -1; the subsequent return ret; cannot be reached. MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 forbids unreachable code in the project’s translation units for the build configuration in use, so in those configurations this code violates Rule 2.1. (In other build configurations where sysctl code runs and ret may be changed, the final return may be reachable; the rule violation depends on the actual project build configuration.)
